active_learning.discussion_prompt: In what ways do business logic errors differ from technical vulnerabilities like SQL injection (CWE-89)? Debate whether developers or business analysts should primarily own their prevention, using OWASP examples to support arguments. Consider prerequisites like authentication flaws.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Generate high-quality Anki-compatible flashcards on 'Business Logic Errors' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Common Web Application Vulnerabilities > 003_Insecure Design > Business Logic Vulnerabilities > Business Logic Errors). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, 4-layer scaffolding, and research context (CWE-840: flaws enabling manipulation of app logic; OWASP A04:2021-Insecure Design; full OWASP WSTG tests: Test Business Logic Data Validation, Process Timing, Function Limits, Workflow Circumvention, Defenses Against Flaws; Sources: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/840.html, https://owasp.org/Top10/A04_2021-Insecure_Design/, https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/stable/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/10-Business_Logic_Testing/. Emphasize differences from technical vulns, business domain dependency, devastating impacts. Incorporate pedagogy: Bloom's progression, active learning (e.g., reference discussion on dev vs. analyst ownership, e-comm problem-solving), scaffolding layers, prerequisites (SQLi, auth flaws), concept map. Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"type": "Q&A|MCQ|Application", "front": "...", "back": "...", "layer": 1-4, "bloom": "REMEMBER|UNDERSTAND|APPLY|ANALYZE|EVALUATE|CREATE", "explanation": "Detailed rationale + misconception + ref."}. Follow flashcard_schema exactly: Q&A for recall, MCQs with distractor protocol (misconceptions like confusing with injection), Application for scenarios. Ensure 20-30 cards balanced by layer/Bloom's. Make fronts active recall prompts.
